meanings.definition: A type of fish found in North Atlantic waters, known for its large head and wide mouth.
meanings.sent1: The monkfish swam gracefully through the ocean.
meanings.sent2: I cooked a delicious monkfish for dinner last night.
meanings.sent3: Why did the monkfish refuse to share its seaweed salad? Because it was a little shellfish!
meanings.sent4: Her curiosity was a monkfish, always ready to devour new information.
meanings.sent5: The monkfish's wide mouth made it look like it was always smiling.

meanings.definition: The flesh of this fish, often used in cooking for its firm texture and mild flavor.
meanings.sent1: The monkfish fillet was tender and flavorful.
meanings.sent2: She seasoned the monkfish with herbs and spices before grilling it.
meanings.sent3: Why did the monkfish join the cooking class? To learn how to be the best fillet in town!
meanings.sent4: His words were like monkfish, satisfying and leaving you wanting more.
meanings.sent5: The monkfish dish was so delicious, it melted in my mouth.
